My hypothesis that Dark Matter is not a weakly interactive massive particle (WIMP), but maybe is a deformation of space-time by which the curvature of space-time itself is the cause of the gravitational effect. Gravity is the consequence of the curvature of space-time when mass is present.  It may be possible that the structure of space-time itself could be warped without the presence of mass.  So, how did this warping occur?  We believe this warping of space-time occurred during the extreme conditions present during inflation. Space-time has been shown to react like a fabric by warping, twisting, and propagating independent of mass. These properties have been proven with observations of gravitational lensing, frame dragging, and now gravitational waves. Fabrics can be stretched, pressured, and/or heated to the point of deformation. Such extreme conditions were all present during inflation, so it is plausible that space-time’s elastic nature could have hit its yield point and permanently deformed. Therefore, if gravity is the consequence of the warping of space-time, and fabrics can be permanently deformed, then a deformation could create a gravitational effect independent of mass. Thus, the unidentified dark "matter" that seems to be so elusive to modern science may not be matter at all but merely warped deformities causing gravitational effects.  We have a prediction using gravitational lens mapping to prove Dark Matter isn’t a weakly interacting massive particle, but instead is a floating fixed pocket of warped geodesics in space-time geometry causing gravity wells.

When two magnets repel each other, they are not PUSHING each other away, instead, surrounding objects behind are PULLING the object towards them because when you bring these repelling magnets close to each other, the magnetic force lines directly between two objects are forced to bend to the side and shoot backwards, these lines hit objects behind them which in turn are drawn to the magnet who sent that force line out.

This is how gravity works. All the field lines of the suns magnetic/atomic field are going far into space and interact with all the atoms in the other planets magnetically, all these atoms are then attracted to the suns field lines.

That is how the earth gravitates towards the sun because the suns field lines are hitting the earth and pulling all earths atoms in magnetically.

This is why our own bodies fall to the centre of the earth, because earths field is far larger than our own field. The atoms of the whole earth combine into one powerful force and attract the atoms of our own body via these magnetic tethers. Every atom is magnetic, we have proven this by suspending frogs in the air inside a large magnetic field.

Our solar system is just one massive magnetic field, and all the planets line up around the sun settle into the same horizontal orbit, orbiting around the base or centre of this massive field. Dark Matter is composed of atoms that are closely packed together.

Normal Matter has the electrons orbiting the neutrons and protons. Dark Matter has the electrons stuck together with the protons and electrons.

This is achieved when enough matter collects in a singular location to create a mass so great that light cannot escape it. The resulting pressure caused by this mass causes the electrons in all the atoms to collapse. So a large amount of matter can collect in very small amount of space.

Invisible, Halo Bok Globules = Cold Dark Matter

A baryonic alternative that requires no expansion of the Standard Model of particle physics hasn't been examined:

If gravitationally-bound proto-galaxies condensed in the first hours or days following the Big Bang, then reionization of the universe beginning about 150 Million years after the Big Bang may have been condensation of proto-galactic continuum into gravitationally-bound (Bok) globules, on the order of 10s to 100s of solar masses within the size of our solar system, about 1 light year across.

Then the largest Bok globules collapsed to form the first (Population III) stars, with smaller globules cooling over the intervening 13-1/2 billion years to become the coldest objects in the natural world.

Continuing In the condensation theme, the subsequent stellar metallicitycondenses into icy chondrules (like hailstones) at around 10 Kelvins, rendering the remaining helium and molecular hydrogen invisible, and thus dark.

Dark-matter Bok globules on steeply-inclined halo orbits periodically run the gauntlet of disk crossing every couple hundred million years or so, with the possibility of stars passing through them or worse, getting trapped by the spider web of giant molecular clouds (GMCs).  Once trapped within GMCs, inward diffusion of new stellar metallicity and sublimation of existing icy chondrule metallicity turn the formerly invisible globules opaque and thus visible.  And gaseous stellar metallicity promotes star formation (by lowering the speed of sound), ultimately converting Bok globules trapped by giant molecular clouds into star clusters.  And as stars condense within Bok globules inside GMCs, outgassing of the leftover gas helps to trap the next generation of Bok globules from their disk-crossing halo orbits, sustaining the GMC spider web until ultimately the combined stellar radiation of the nascent star cluster completely dispels their birth nebula, revealing a new star cluster.

And Bok globule dark matter overcomes the 'cuspy halo problem' of WIMP models, (whereby our galactic core and globular clusters are devoid of dark matter) if baryonic dark mater globules convert to stars and luminous gas in high density regions of galactic cores, globular clusters and giant molecular clouds.
